page.title: 08 Kestle Mill(2)
page.content: Mrs May showed us an old photograph which was taken about 100 years ago The number of people in the photograph shows just how busy the village was. Most of the men were farm labourers. Village life centred on the Chapel. Mrs May used to teach in the Sunday School and played the organ until the Chapel was closed in 1971.It is now up for sale with planning permission for converting it into holiday accommodation. Most of the people moved away as machines replaced the farmworkers.The mill became disused and all that remains of it are two old millstones by the farmhouse. Everyone we spoke to said how peaceful it was living in Kestle Mill. The only disadvantage was the lack of transport and the lack of mains gas.
